rComments: Professor Read is a very difficult professor! His class honestly is more diffucult than need be! The teachers aides are just little to passionate! Especially Xioa Ping! Beware of her, she's a difficult grader and you can't even understand her!!!! Take with precaution and please take it seriously!!!

One of my top 2 classes taken during my undergraduate career, with the other being his graduate seminar on Chinese Contemporary Policy. Professor Read lives up to the prestige of a Harvard Ph.D, providing a truly unique and amazing learning experience that is uncommon outside of top tier universities. Be prepared to work hard in return.

This class is far and away the HARDEST class I have taken at UCSC. Loads of complex reading, and the entire class grade is based on a lengthy midterm and final, with no curve on either one. I did well in the class, but I can't recommend it to anyone unless they have a very strong interest in third world politics, or a masochistic view of studying.

Excellent lecturer on Politics In China. Even with putting in a great deal of effort in the course, you will not get an A.  He grades incredibly hard.  Quizzes meant to check if you did the reading  are graded down for minor things. Expectations too high for undergrad.

Not a very engaging lecturer. He takes role once a week and sometimes in the beginning of  class so if you're late, you count as absent. Completely comprehensive with lots of reading material. He is not interested in your opinion. Only take this class if you HAVE to.

He's amazing! Let me start with that this class is NOT easy. Go into this class expecting a lot of work and be willing to do all of it. It's all reading so it is extremely easy to fall behind. I flunked the midterm, and so I went straight to him and he was super helpful. He is very intelligent and clearly passionate, but the class is very difficult

Not an easy class but if you manage your time and take good notes on the readings and review notes every week class shouldn't be that hard, dont be lazy and you'll pass. Def not a lower div in terms of content

He is really nice and fun. I am a politics major so of course this class interests me. If you're not a politics major you probably won't like it. Everyone complaining he is not a clear lecturer needs to remember they have to listen. He is willing to answer any questions. He is really good with communicating as well. One of my favorite professors.

He is a very clear lecturer and a very helpful professor. It is a very informative and helpful class. I am a second year politics major and this was the most difficult class I have taken so far. Nevertheless it is an awesome class and he is an awesome professor!

Ben Read is amazing. These other reviewers make it seem like he is the worst professor in the world. If you're a politics major, this is a great class. If you aren't, you probably won't like it. This class is a great experience and the professor is very professional and willing to help if you're willing to try. (:

Took this class out of curiosity and was completely apalled at how the class was taught. Mr. Read insists that his class is more of an upper division course, yet he taught virtually ever lecture through documentaries. It is impossible to decipher exactly how he wants your analysis to look like because all he teaches is history

The class was pretty good. Now that I've gone through other politics classes I can attest that Read is one of the best. You go to office hours and he's actually willing to talk with you. The class was informative.

Very hard class. Read his ridiculous amount of assigned reading, took 108 hand written notes (not including my typed 15 page study guides), and attended every lecture/section and still felt completely unprepared for the midterm and final. Hard class. Informative but boring. Seems like a nice guy though.

too hard for a lower div class. You're entire grade is the midterm and the final, yet he gives out study guides that end up being 40 pages long. The exams are also ridiculously difficult, because if you miss one short answer question your grade drops almost 20 percent. DONT take this class, unless you have no choice. Not worth it.

This classs should be upper division, its freakin hard. As a freshman that is not a politics major I wanted to take this class because i thought developing countries were interesting, but it is absolute death. DONT DO IT

For an intro class, POLI60 is very difficult. Our midterm's study guide ended up being over thirty pages on my computer when I finished it, and I still only scraped a C with 10+ hours of studying. He is a very poor public speaker, "uh" between every couples of words, not very engaging at all.

i have a midterm for this class in a few hours and i feel so unprepared because this prof gives an impossible-to-complete study guide! it is a cumulative guide & he doesnt tell you what exactly to study so we end up wasting our lives away studying for the exam. he is nice overall, but truly unreasonable for exams! AND his standards are TOO high!

A lot of people complained that attendance was mandatory but if you're seriously unwilling to go to class, then why are you in college? Isn't that kind of the point? He's tough and not the most popular professor, but he has so much knowledge to offer. He's there to teach. A lot of reading and a touch grader. The class was very rewarding.
Read is a harvard phd and it shows. Smart guy good class. Organized professional. There's a good two hours of reading per lecture though.
In a time when college is obsolete mandatory attendance is UNACCEPTABLE. To be causing us this harm just because it was caused to you when you went to college is unethical.
Tough but fair. Extemely helpful; extremely knowledgable. If you do all the reading you wont have any problems. Attendance mandatory.

This class is super easy if you keep up with the reading.  I agree with the person below, his public speaking skills are not too great, he does "ummmmm" a lot, which can be pretty distracting.  But he's a nice guy, not a bad teacher, and if you really put in effort to get a good grade, chances are you will.

Hes not bad at all, you have to attend lectures, but besides that nothing out of the ordinary. The midterm and final make your grade so make sure to study, he gives study guides that are very similar to test.not an easy class but work for it and you will do fine.He is very professional looking but he is there to help.

I loved this class. I found the lectures to be interesting and well formatted. The slides were well organized and very helpful for reviewing for tests. The documentaries he showed were amazing. Prof Read was very helpful during office hours and in class. Well informed, but admits when he doesn't know something. Very down to earth.

Tries to be very helpful, but was unclear of expectations for weekly written assignments.  Does not appreciate theoretical perspectives and appears to have an American bias - odd considering he focuses entirely on China.  Overall you will learn a lot, but need to be aware of the bias

This teacher is absolutely terrible!!!  He has very poor communication skills (his favorite word was ummm) and he has a poor high schooler's vocabulary.  Additionally, he is not well informed in his subject and routinely gave phony excuses instead of answering questions.  Finally, ever single lecture came directly from Wikipedia.  STAY AWAY!!!!!
